Trial_Design.evidence: 54 patients scheduled for laparoscopic nephrectomy were allocated

Intervention.evidence: allocated to receive either ESPB or QLB with 25 mL of 0.4% ropivacaine

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to directly compare the analgesic effectiveness and recovery benefits of ESPB versus QLB

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was cumulative morphine consumption within 6 hours postoperatively

Result_Outcome.evidence: Patients receiving ESPB had significantly lower morphine consumption during the first 6 hours postoperatively compared to those receiving QLB (4.11±4.05 vs. 6.63±4.61 mg, P<0.05)

Harms.evidence: No block-related complications were observed in either group

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial Registration: Chinese Clinical Trial Registry, ChiCTR2300074743
